content.description: This is a good, tall problem on the Engine Block's south west face. Start below the huge hueco and move upward. Avoiding the hueco makes it a bit harder, but it's always there if you'd rather use it.
content.location: What You Talkin' 'Bout, Gillis? is located on the north face of the Engine Block. There's a downclimb on the northwest face.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand edge and a left hand gaston. From there, pull up through a series of edges to reach a great edge next to the hueco, then traverse left using a small shield, and continue traversing left using the bumps to top out the problem.
content.protection:
A pair of pads should be fine. The immediate landing is good, with the exception of a few rocks that are easily padded. It starts just to the left of

Ahimsa

.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Engine.

content.description:
Sit start with a left hand sloper, a right hand edge, and right heel hook. From there, reach and match on the chickenhead, then begin traversing right with a big move to the featured lip, continue traversing until you connect with the edges of

That's What I'm Talkin' 'Bout

, make a big move to the jug above, and finish up the remaining bumps.

This shares the same start as

Shape Refused

.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a perfect landing though.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Engine.

content.description:
This adds a sit start to

What You Talkin' 'Bout, Gillis?

Sit start with a right hand crimp, a left hand two-finger edge, and a great left foot. From there, gain and match on the edge above, work through the hueco to a set of edges to the left, make a big move to the jug on the slab, and finish up the remaining bumps for an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is perfect though.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Engine.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand edge and a right hand pocket. From there, climb straight up through the edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. It has a great landing, but it does climb between a pair of nasty rocks.
content.location:
It climbs the west face of Engine, a few feet right of

Ahimsa

.

content.description:
Sit start almost completely horizontal with half of your body underneath the overhang. From there, go up to a large chicken-head, get your feet beneath and move up through the juniper tree branches on the remaining slab with good bumps. It is a bit of a dirty problem but fun nonetheless. A more difficult variation may be possible that begins with the same start but traverses right and goes up.

Same start as Total Protonic Reversal.
content.location: This is on the north face of the Engine Boulder.

content.description: This is to the left of the Festivus problems on the Engine Boulder. Start with an awesome undercling with spread-eagle feet. Move up with a right hand to a sloping crimp. From there, follow up with good hand holds and poor, non-existent feet to the top.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter, but the landing is great.
content.location: This is on the south side of the Engine Boulder just left of the Festivus problems.

content.description: Stand start with a right hand sidepull-edge and a left hand edge. From there, gain a pair of edges above, bring the feet up high, follow to the jug-bump, and traverse slight left onto the featured slab for an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The immediate landing is quite good, but there is the boulder behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Engine, just left of Turn the Environmental Knob.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand pocket and a right hand edge. From there, stick an incut right hand edge, walk the feet over, tic tac through a few small edges, gain the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is perfect.
content.location:
It climbs the east face of Engine and is in between

Airing of the Grievances

and

Feats of Strength

.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand pocket and a left hand two-finger pocket. From there, gain a left hand crimp, bump through it to a left hand edge on the sloper, follow and match on the jug above, gain the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad. It has a perfect landing.
content.location: It climbs the center of Engine's south face.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand pocket and a right hand edge. From there, stand to a right hand edge, match on it, and continue straight up through the remaining edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad. It has a great landing.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Engine.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand edge. From there, pull up through a series of edges to reach a mini-shelf, follow to a pair of edges at the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but there is a nasty rock just to the right of the problem.
content.location:
It climbs the west face of Engine, in between

Turn the Environmental Knob

and

Sinny Sun

.
